alert.note: Alert for Northern Calcasieu; Southern Calcasieu; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 06 at 1:06PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Louisiana and southeast Texas, including the following areas and parishes, in Louisiana, Northern Calcasieu, Rapides, Southern Calcasieu and West Cameron. In southeast Texas, Lower Jefferson, Northern Orange, Southern Orange and Upper Jefferson. * WHEN...From 6 PM CDT this evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A stalled frontal boundary will create multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain. Rainfall amounts of 4 to 7 inches with locally higher amounts will be possible by Friday afternoon in extreme Southeast Texas and extreme southwest Louisiana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Calcasieu; Southern Calcasieu; West Cameron
